               tiles='cartodbpositron', # type of map
               min_zoom=4, max_zoom=6, # zoom range
               zoom_start=4) # initial zoom

# plot chorpleth over the base map
folium.Choropleth(states,                                # geo data
                  data=states,                           # data
                  key_on='feature.properties.statename', # feature.properties.key
                  columns=['statename', 'totalpopul'],   # [key, value]
                  fill_color='RdPu',                     # cmap
                  line_weight=0.1,                       # line wight (of the border)
                  line_opacity=0.5,                      # line opacity (of the border)
                  legend_name='Population').add_to(m)    # name on the legend color bar

# add layer controls
folium.LayerControl().add_to(m)

### Shape files
* .shp files can be read using geopandas using .read_file() function  
* .shp files contain ***geometry*** column in which the shape of each individual piece inside a map  
* geometry can be a point, line, polygon, or multipolygon

## GeoPandas and Folium
* we use **geopandas** to import data instead of pandas.
* geopandas is one of the popular and widely used to library to work with shape files  


* GeoPandas makes working with geospatial data in python easier.   
* Geopandas comes with a lot of special function that makes working with Geospatial data lot easy.   [](http://)
* One can also plot geospatial map using geopandas
* See the documentation here : https://geopandas.org/  
  
  
* **Folium** is another library that can produce more interactive google maps like geospatial maps.
* See the documentation here : https://python-visualization.github.io/folium/quickstart.html
